title: How to solve the following differential equation: 3x y^2 y^2 y'+3y^2=1 - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ll assume you mistakenly wrote [math]y^2[/math] twice here also, remember that [math]y' = \frac{dy}{dx}[/math] [math]3x y^2y'+3y^2=1[/math] separate the [math]x[/math] and [math]y[/math] terms [math]y^2(3x \frac{dy}{dx}+3) = 1[/math] [math]3x \frac{dy}{dx}+3 = \frac{1}{y^2}[/math] [math]3x \frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{1}{y^2} - 3[/math] move the terms such that [math]y[/math] terms are next to the [math]\frac{dy}{dx}[/math] [math]\frac{1}{\frac{1}{y^2} - 3} (\frac{dy}{dx}) = \frac{1}{3x}[/math] multiply both sides by [math]dx[/math] [math](\frac{y^2}{1 - 3y^2}) dy = (\frac{1}{3x}) dx[/math] Since there are [math]dy[/math] and [math]dx[/math], this means we must integrate each side by their respective variables [math]\int(\frac{y^2}{1 - 3y^2}) dy = \frac{1}{3}\int(\frac{1}{x}) dx[/math] Integrating, we get [math]\frac{\sqrt{3}\left(\ln\left(\left|3y+\sqrt{3}\right|\right)-\ln\left(\left|3y-\sqrt{3}\right|\right)\right)-6y}{18} = \frac{lnx}{3}[/math] —————————— NOTE that: [math]\sqrt{3}[\ln(3y+\sqrt{3})-\ln(3y-\sqrt{3})] =\sqrt{3}\ln[\frac{(3y+\sqrt{3})}{(3y-\sqrt{3})}] [/math] and let [math]\ln(\frac{3y+\sqrt{3}}{3y-\sqrt{3}})[/math] be equal to [math]a[/math] for convenience, so [math]\sqrt{3}[\ln(3y+\sqrt{3})-\ln(3y-\sqrt{3})] =\sqrt{3}\ln(a) [/math] —————————— back to where we were now [math]\frac{\sqrt{3}\left(\ln\left(\left|3y+\sqrt{3}\right|\right)-\ln\left(\left|3y-\sqrt{3}\right|\right)\right)-6y}{18} = \frac{lnx}{3}[/math] [math]\sqrt{3}[\ln(3y+\sqrt{3})-\ln(3y-\sqrt{3})] -6y = 6\ln(x)[/math] [math]\sqrt{3}\ln(a) - 6y = 6\ln(x)[/math] [math]\ln(a^{\sqrt{3}}) - 6y\ln(e) = \ln(x^6)[/math] [math]\ln(a^{\sqrt{3}}) - \ln(e^{6y}) = \ln(x^6)[/math] [math] \ln(\frac{a^{\sqrt{3}}}{e^{6y}})=\ln(x^6)[/math] eliminating [math]\ln[/math] [math]\frac{a^{\sqrt{3}}}{e^{6y}} = x^6[/math] that’s the general equation for the D.E given above, you could find x in terms of y though [math](\frac{a^{\sqrt{3}}}{e^{6y}})^{\frac{1}{6}} = x[/math] [math]x = \Bigg(\frac{\ln\bigr(\frac{3y+\sqrt{3}}{3y-\sqrt{3}}\bigr)^{\sqrt{3}}}{e^{6y}}\Bigg)^{\frac{1}{6}}[/math] It was very tedious and i may have let some mistakes here or there, please anyone, feel free to correct me :)
